title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 10 §§ 88-1.2 - Priority of admissions
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 10 §§ 88-1.2 - Priority of admissions

State Regulations

Preference in admission shall be given to those cases most in need of the type of service the institution can provide; otherwise, so far as practicable, patients shall be admitted within priority categories established by each disability center chief. Admissions of nonresidents shall be made so as not to deny significantly postpone the admission or care at the hospital of residents of New York. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 10
§§
88-1.2

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
